title: Report of the International Atomic Energy Agency
text:
United Nations 
A/80/L.7 
 
 
General Assembly 
Distr.: Limited 
22 October 2025 
Original: English 
 
25-17051 (E)    281025 
*2517051* 
 
 
Eightieth session 
Agenda item 89 
Report of the International Atomic Energy Agency 
 
 
 
 
 
Australia:* draft resolution 
 
 
 
 Report of the International Atomic Energy Agency 
 
 
 
The General Assembly, 
 
Having received the report of the International Atomic Energy Agency for 
2024,1 
 
Taking note of the statement by the Director General of the Agency, in which he 
provided additional information on the main developments in the activities of the 
Agency during 2025, 
 
Recognizing the importance of the work of the Agency, 
 
Recognizing also the cooperation between the United Nations and the Agency and 
the Agreement governing the relationship between the United Nations and the Agency 
as approved by the General Conference of the Agency on 23 October 1957 and by the 
General Assembly in the annex to its resolution 1145 (XII) of 14 November 1957, 
 
1. 
Takes note with appreciation of the report of the International Atomic 
Energy Agency; 
 
2. 
Takes note of resolutions GC(69)/RES/7, entitled “Nuclear and radiation 
safety”; GC(69)/RES/8, entitled “Nuclear security”; GC(69)/RES/9, entitled 
“Strengthening the Agency’s activities related to nuclear science, technology and 
applications”, comprising GC(69)/RES/9 A.2, entitled “Support to the African Union’s 
Pan African Tsetse and Trypanosomosis Eradication Campaign (AU-PATTEC)”, 
GC(69)/RES/9 A.3, entitled “Zoonotic Disease Integrated Action (ZODIAC) Project”, 
and GC(69)/RES/9 B, entitled “Nuclear power applications”; GC(69)/RES/10, entitled 
“Extending the Technical Cooperation Programme for the State of Palestine to the Gaza 
Strip”; GC(69)/RES/13, entitled “Implementation of the NPT safeguards agreement 
between the Agency and the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea”; GC(69)/RES/14, 
entitled “Nuclear safety, security and safeguards in Ukraine”; GC(69)/RES/15, entitled 
“Application of IAEA safeguards in the Middle East”; and GC(69)/RES/16, entitled 
“Personnel”, comprising GC(69)/RES/16 A, entitled “Staffing of the Agency’s 
Secretariat” and GC(69)/RES/16 B, entitled “Women in the Secretariat”; and decisions 
GC(69)/DEC/10, entitled “Amendment to Article XIV.A of the Statute”; 
__________________ 
 
* Any changes to the list of sponsors will be reflected in the official record of the meeting. 
 
1  See A/80/348. 

A/80/L.7 
 
25-17051
2/2 
 
GC(69)/DEC/11, entitled “Promotion of efficiency and effectiveness of the IAEA 
decision making process”, and GC(69)/DEC/12, entitled “Amendment to Article VI of 
the Statute”, adopted by the General Conference of the Agency at its sixty-ninth regular 
session, held from 15 to 19 September 2025;2 and of the statements by the President of 
the General Conference with regard to the General Conference agenda item 8 entitled 
“Election of Members to the Board of Governors”;3 item 15 entitled “Strengthening of 
the Agency’s technical cooperation activities”; item 16 entitled “Strengthening the 
Agency’s activities related to nuclear science, technology and applications”; and 
item 17 entitled “Strengthening the effectiveness and improving the efficiency of 
Agency safeguards”, all as reflected in the official records of the General Conference; 
 
3. 
Reaffirms its strong support for the indispensable role of the Agency in 
encouraging and assisting the development and practical application of atomic energy 
for peaceful uses, in technology transfer to developing countries and in nuclear safety, 
verification and security; 
 
4. 
Appeals to Member States to continue to support the activities of the 
Agency; 
 
5. 
Requests the Secretary-General to transmit to the Director General of the 
Agency the records of the eightieth session of the General Assembly relating to the 
activities of the Agency. 
 
__________________ 
 
2  See International Atomic Energy Agency, Resolutions Adopted and Other Relevant Decisions 
Taken during the 69th Regular Session of the General Conference, 15–19 September 2025 
(GC(69)/RES/DEC(2025)) for the full texts of relevant resolutions and decisions and 
information regarding their adoption. 
 
3  See International Atomic Energy Agency General Conference resolution GC(67)/RES/15, 
entitled “Restoration of the Sovereign  Equality of Member States in the IAEA”.

paragraphs.1: Takes note with appreciation of the report of the International Atomic Energy Agency;
paragraphs.2: Takes note of resolutions GC(69)/RES/7, entitled “Nuclear and radiation safety”; GC(69)/RES/8, entitled “Nuclear security”; GC(69)/RES/9, entitled “Strengthening the Agency’s activities related to nuclear science, technology and applications”, comprising GC(69)/RES/9 A.2, entitled “Support to the African Union’s Pan African Tsetse and Trypanosomosis Eradication Campaign (AU-PATTEC)”, GC(69)/RES/9 A.3, entitled “Zoonotic Disease Integrated Action (ZODIAC) Project”, and GC(69)/RES/9 B, entitled “Nuclear power applications”; GC(69)/RES/10, entitled “Extending the Technical Cooperation Programme for the State of Palestine to the Gaza Strip”; GC(69)/RES/13, entitled “Implementation of the NPT safeguards agreement between the Agency and the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea”; GC(69)/RES/14, entitled “Nuclear safety, security and safeguards in Ukraine”; GC(69)/RES/15, entitled “Application of IAEA safeguards in the Middle East”; and GC(69)/RES/16, entitled “Personnel”, comprising GC(69)/RES/16 A, entitled “Staffing of the Agency’s Secretariat” and GC(69)/RES/16 B, entitled “Women in the Secretariat”; and decisions GC(69)/DEC/10, entitled “Amendment to Article XIV.A of the Statute”; GC(69)/DEC/11, entitled “Promotion of efficiency and effectiveness of the IAEA decision making process”, and GC(69)/DEC/12, entitled “Amendment to Article VI of the Statute”, adopted by the General Conference of the Agency at its sixty-ninth regular session, held from 15 to 19 September 2025;2 and of the statements by the President of the General Conference with regard to the General Conference agenda item 8 entitled “Election of Members to the Board of Governors”;3 item 15 entitled “Strengthening of the Agency’s technical cooperation activities”; item 16 entitled “Strengthening the Agency’s activities related to nuclear science, technology and applications”; and item 17 entitled “Strengthening the effectiveness and improving the efficiency of Agency safeguards”, all as reflected in the official records of the General Conference;
paragraphs.3: Reaffirms its strong support for the indispensable role of the Agency in encouraging and assisting the development and practical application of atomic energy for peaceful uses, in technology transfer to developing countries and in nuclear safety, verification and security;
paragraphs.4: Appeals to Member States to continue to support the activities of the Agency;
paragraphs.5: Requests the Secretary-General to transmit to the Director General of the Agency the records of the eightieth session of the General Assembly relating to the activities of the Agency.
